title: Newtons second law - cm motion of two-star system

content.question: Two stars in deep space are very far from any other objects. The two stars orbit the center of mass of the two-star system in circular orbits at constant speed. Which of the following claims is correct about the motion of the center of mass of the two-star system?

choices.label: The center of mass also moves in circular motion.
The center of mass does not accelerate.
The acceleration of the center of mass depends on the relative masses of the stars.
The acceleration of the center of mass depends on the relative speeds of the stars.

content.answer: The center of mass does not accelerate.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
